Authorities

Authorities

OMB issues this Circular pursuant to the following statutes and Executive Orders:

  1. Budget and Accounting Procedures Act of 1950, as amended (31 U.S.C. § Chapter 11);
  2. Chief Financial Officers Act (31 U.S.C. § 3512 et seq.);
  3. Clinger-Cohen Act (also known as the “Information Technology Management Reform Act of 1996”) (40 U.S.C. § 11101-11704);
  4. Confidential Information Protection and Statistical Efficiency Act of 2002 (CIPSEA) (44 U.S.C. § 3501 note);
  5. Digital Accountability and Transparency Act of 2014 (Pub. L. 113-101);
  6. E-Government Act of 2002 (44 U.S.C. § 101);
  7. Economy Act of 1933 (38 U.S.C. § 701);
  8. Federal Acquisition Streamlining Act of 1994 (Pub. L. 103-355);
  9. Federal Information Security Modernization Act of 2014 (44 U.S.C. chapter 35);
  10. Federal Information Technology Acquisition Reform Act (FITARA) (Pub. L. 113-291);
  11. Federal Property and Administrative Services Act of 1940, as amended (40 U.S.C. §§ 101-18304);
  12. Federal Records Act of 1950, as amended, codified (44 U.S.C. chapters 21, 29, 31, 33);
  13. Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552);
  14. General Services Administration Modernization Act (40 U.S.C. § 101);
  15. Government Paperwork Elimination Act of 1998 (44 U.S.C. § 3504);
  16. Government Performance and Results Act (GPRA) of 1993, as amended by the Government Performance and Results Modernization Act (GPRM) of 2010 (5 U.S.C. § 306 and 31 U.S.C. §§ 1115 et seq.);
  17. Information Quality Act (44 U.S.C. §§ 3504(d)(1) and 3516);
  18. National Institute of Standards and Technologies Act (15 U.S.C. § 271 et seq.);
  19. Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act (41 U.S.C. chapter 7);
  20. Paperwork Reduction Act (PRA) of 1980, as amended by the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 (44 U.S.C. chapter 35);
  21. Presidential and Federal Records Act Amendments of 2014 (Pub. L. 113-187);
  22. Privacy Act of 1974, as amended (5 U.S.C. §552a);
  23. Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (as amended (29 U.S.C. §794d);
  24. Executive Order No. 12046, Relating to the Transfer of Telecommunications Functions, of March 27, 1978;
  25. Executive Order No. 12472, Assignment of National Security and Emergency Preparedness Telecommunications Functions, of April 3, 1984; and
  26. Other relevant statutes and Executive Orders.
